title: PM Update: Still gray, with some rain working in late Wednesday
text:
A ghoulish scene on Swann Street NW. (Mike Maguire/Flickr)

Despite clouds ruling the day, temperatures were able to slide into the mid- and upper 60s in most spots. There’s no major change in the forecast through Wednesday, other than introducing a greater chance of rain. That said, much of the day Wednesday should stay dry.

Listen to our daily D.C. forecasts: Apple Podcasts | Amazon Echo | More options

Through tonight: Clouds will remain entrenched and may thicken again overnight. There could be patchy fog or drizzle late at night and toward dawn. Lows will range from the upper 40s in the coolest spots north and west to the mid-50s in the city. Winds will be light from the east.

View the current weather at The Washington Post.

Tomorrow (Wednesday): It will be a cloudy start with perhaps some patchy fog. It will remain cloudy through the day, and a few showers may work into the area during the afternoon, but the bulk of any rain should hold off until the evening or early night. Highs will be pretty close to those on Tuesday or a touch milder. Let’s call it mid-60s to near 70.

See Matt Rogers’s forecast through the weekend. And if you haven’t already, join us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter and Instagram. For related traffic news, check out Gridlock.

Pollen update: Mold spores are low/moderate. The other main allergens are low.

Stormy photos: The winners of the 2019 weather photograph of the year, as submitted to the U.K.’s Royal Meteorological Society, have been posted. Check ‘em out at The Guardian. Some great stuff!

Want our 5 a.m. forecast delivered to your email inbox? Subscribe here.
description: It will be mainly dry during the day, though.
authors: Ian Livingston Is A Forecaster Photographer
Information Lead For The Capital Weather Gang. Day
National Security Researcher At A D.C. Think Tank.
